titles.title: Expressing the sense of the House of Representatives regarding the need to eliminate partisan redistricting and gerrymandering.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on the Constitution and Civil Justice.

bill.summary:
7/10/2015--Introduced. Expresses the sense of the House of Representatives that:
Congress should establish a federal reapportionment system that would create compact and contiguous congressional districts that, to the greatest extent possible, follow geographic boundaries and county lines; congressional districts should not favor or disfavor an incumbent or political party; congressional districts should adhere to the existing standards of equal population; and the highest court of each state should have the power to reject congressional district maps that do not meet the above criteria.
